DataElement.preferredName: Patient Barium Swallow Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a modified barium swallow to assess swallowing function was done prior to enrolling a patient on the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Barium Swallow Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a modified barium swallow function assessment which is required to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Barium Swallow Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Ba, atomic number 56, and atomic weight 137.:Ingest through the mouth.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A naturally occurring alkaline metalloid element with atomic symbol Ba, atomic number 56, and atomic weight 137 that is only found in combination with other elements, typically barite (barium sulfate) and witherite (barium carbonate), or chemicals. Barium is used in many industrial processes, as well as in diagnostic testing, fireworks, and pesticides. It is characterized as a silvery white or yellow to white metallic solid that is odorless. Exposure occurs by inhalation, ingestion, or contact.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
